Siddhattha, the knower of the world,

Siddhattha, the leader of the world,
When the god of men had risen up,
the white parasol also rose up,
in front of the best Buddha,
I do not recall a bad destination,
is the fruit of the flower-parasol.
In the four hundred and seventy years,
I have done the Buddha’s bidding.”🔽Thus the elder Pupphacchattiya recited these verses.
